prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Unidentified general store account book, 1840-1843. Local government records collection, Cumberland County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Cumberland County.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The general store conducted business in Cumberland County.
Cumberland County was named for William Augustus, duke of Cumberland, third son of King George II. It was formed from Goochland County in 1749. The county seat is Cumberland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Unidentified general store account book, 1840-1843, records transactions as they occurred on an almost daily basis from March 2, 1840-October 30, 1843. Information found in each entry includes name of customer, items purchased, and the amount owed and paid. Merchandise sold include sugar, scissors, brandy, clothing, dishes, and coffee.

controlaccess.head: Genre and Form Terms:
controlaccess.genreform: Local government records -- Virginia -- Cumberland County.
